verses.verse: The word <S%H1697><s%> which came unto Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> from the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, when Nebuchadnezzar <S%H5019><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%>, and all his army <S%H2428><s%>, and all the kingdoms <S%H4467><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> of his dominion <S%H3027><s%> <S%H4475><s%>, and all the people <S%H5971><s%>, fought <S%H3898><s%> against Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>, and against all the cities <S%H5892><s%> thereof, saying <S%H559><s%>,

Thus saith <S%H559><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, the God <S%H430><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>; Go <S%H1980><s%> and speak <S%H559><s%> to Zedekiah <S%H6667><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%>, and tell <S%H559><s%> him, Thus saith <S%H559><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%>; Behold, I will give <S%H5414><s%> this city <S%H5892><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%>, and he shall burn <S%H8313><s%> it with fire <S%H784><s%>:

And thou shalt not escape out <S%H4422><s%> of his hand <S%H3027><s%>, but shalt surely <S%H8610><s%> be taken <S%H8610><s%>, and delivered <S%H5414><s%> into his hand <S%H3027><s%>; and thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> shall behold <S%H7200><s%> the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%>, and he shall speak <S%H1696><s%> with thee mouth <S%H6310><s%> to mouth <S%H6310><s%>, and thou shalt go <S%H935><s%> to Babylon <S%H894><s%>.

Yet hear <S%H8085><s%> the word <S%H1697><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, O Zedekiah <S%H6667><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%>; Thus saith <S%H559><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> of thee, Thou shalt not die <S%H4191><s%> by the sword <S%H2719><s%>:

But thou shalt die <S%H4191><s%> in peace <S%H7965><s%>: and with the burnings <S%H4955><s%> of thy fathers <S%H1><s%>, the former <S%H7223><s%> kings <S%H4428><s%> which were before <S%H6440><s%> thee, so shall they burn <S%H8313><s%> odours for thee; and they will lament <S%H5594><s%> thee, saying, Ah <S%H1945><s%> lord <S%H113><s%>! for I have pronounced <S%H1696><s%> the word <S%H1697><s%>, saith <S%H5002><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%>.

Then Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> the prophet <S%H5030><s%> spake <S%H1696><s%> all these words <S%H1697><s%> unto Zedekiah <S%H6667><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> in Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>,

When the king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon's <S%H894><s%> army <S%H2428><s%> fought <S%H3898><s%> against Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>, and against all the cities <S%H5892><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> that were left <S%H3498><s%>, against Lachish <S%H3923><s%>, and against Azekah <S%H5825><s%>: for these defenced <S%H4013><s%> cities <S%H5892><s%> remained <S%H7604><s%> of the cities <S%H5892><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%>.

¶ This is the word <S%H1697><s%> that came unto Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> from the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, after <S%H310><s%> that the king <S%H4428><s%> Zedekiah <S%H6667><s%> had made <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%> with all the people <S%H5971><s%> which were at Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>, to proclaim <S%H7121><s%> liberty <S%H1865><s%> unto them;

That every man <S%H376><s%> should let his manservant <S%H5650><s%>, and every man <S%H376><s%> his maidservant <S%H8198><s%>, being an Hebrew <S%H5680><s%> or an Hebrewess <S%H5680><s%>, go <S%H7971><s%> free <S%H2670><s%>; that none should serve <S%H5647><s%> himself of them, to wit, of a Jew <S%H3064><s%> his brother <S%H251><s%>.

Now when all the princes <S%H8269><s%>, and all the people <S%H5971><s%>, which had entered <S%H935><s%> into the covenant <S%H1285><s%>, heard <S%H8085><s%> that every one <S%H376><s%> should let his manservant <S%H5650><s%>, and every one <S%H376><s%> his maidservant <S%H8198><s%>, go <S%H7971><s%> free <S%H2670><s%>, that none should serve <S%H5647><s%> themselves of them any more, then they obeyed <S%H8085><s%>, and let them go <S%H7971><s%>.

But afterward <S%H310><s%> they turned <S%H7725><s%>, and caused the servants <S%H5650><s%> and the handmaids <S%H8198><s%>, whom they had let go <S%H7971><s%> free <S%H2670><s%>, to return <S%H7725><s%>, and brought them into subjection <S%H3533><s%> <S%H3533><s%> for servants <S%H5650><s%> and for handmaids <S%H8198><s%>.
¶ Therefore the word <S%H1697><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> came to Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> from the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>,

Thus saith <S%H559><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, the God <S%H430><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>; I made <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%> with your fathers <S%H1><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> that I brought them forth <S%H3318><s%> out of the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, out of the house <S%H1004><s%> of bondmen <S%H5650><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>,

At the end <S%H7093><s%> of seven <S%H7651><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> let ye go <S%H7971><s%> every man <S%H376><s%> his brother <S%H251><s%> an Hebrew <S%H5680><s%>, which hath been sold <S%H4376><s%> unto thee; and when he hath served <S%H5647><s%> thee six <S%H8337><s%> years <S%H8141><s%>, thou shalt let him go <S%H7971><s%> free <S%H2670><s%> from thee: but your fathers <S%H1><s%> hearkened <S%H8085><s%> not unto me, neither inclined <S%H5186><s%> their ear <S%H241><s%>.

And ye were now <S%H3117><s%> turned <S%H7725><s%>, and had done <S%H6213><s%> right <S%H3477><s%> in my sight <S%H5869><s%>, in proclaiming <S%H7121><s%> liberty <S%H1865><s%> every man <S%H376><s%> to his neighbour <S%H7453><s%>; and ye had made <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> me in the house <S%H1004><s%> which is called <S%H7121><s%> by my name <S%H8034><s%>:

But ye turned <S%H7725><s%> and polluted <S%H2490><s%> my name <S%H8034><s%>, and caused every man <S%H376><s%> his servant <S%H5650><s%>, and every man <S%H376><s%> his handmaid <S%H8198><s%>, whom ye had set <S%H7971><s%> at liberty <S%H2670><s%> at their pleasure <S%H5315><s%>, to return <S%H7725><s%>, and brought them into subjection <S%H3533><s%>, to be unto you for servants <S%H5650><s%> and for handmaids <S%H8198><s%>.

Therefore thus saith <S%H559><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%>; Ye have not hearkened <S%H8085><s%> unto me, in proclaiming <S%H7121><s%> liberty <S%H1865><s%>, every one <S%H376><s%> to his brother <S%H251><s%>, and every man <S%H376><s%> to his neighbour <S%H7453><s%>: behold, I proclaim <S%H7121><s%> a liberty <S%H1865><s%> for you, saith <S%H5002><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, to the sword <S%H2719><s%>, to the pestilence <S%H1698><s%>, and to the famine <S%H7458><s%>; and I will make <S%H5414><s%> you to be removed <S%H2189><s%> <S%H2113><s%> into all the kingdoms <S%H4467><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>.

And I will give <S%H5414><s%> the men <S%H582><s%> that have transgressed <S%H5674><s%> my covenant <S%H1285><s%>, which have not performed <S%H6965><s%> the words <S%H1697><s%> of the covenant <S%H1285><s%> which they had made <S%H3772><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> me, when they cut <S%H3772><s%> the calf <S%H5695><s%> in twain <S%H8147><s%>, and passed <S%H5674><s%> between the parts <S%H1335><s%> thereof,

The princes <S%H8269><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%>, and the princes <S%H8269><s%> of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>, the eunuchs <S%H5631><s%>, and the priests <S%H3548><s%>, and all the people <S%H5971><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%>, which passed <S%H5674><s%> between the parts <S%H1335><s%> of the calf <S%H5695><s%>;

I will even give <S%H5414><s%> them into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of their enemies <S%H341><s%>, and into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of them that seek <S%H1245><s%> their life <S%H5315><s%>: and their dead bodies <S%H5038><s%> shall be for meat <S%H3978><s%> unto the fowls <S%H5775><s%> of the heaven <S%H8064><s%>, and to the beasts <S%H929><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>.

And Zedekiah <S%H6667><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> and his princes <S%H8269><s%> will I give <S%H5414><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of their enemies <S%H341><s%>, and into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of them that seek <S%H1245><s%> their life <S%H5315><s%>, and into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon's <S%H894><s%> army <S%H2428><s%>, which are gone up <S%H5927><s%> from you.

Behold, I will command <S%H6680><s%>, saith <S%H5002><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, and cause them to return <S%H7725><s%> to this city <S%H5892><s%>; and they shall fight <S%H3898><s%> against it, and take <S%H3920><s%> it, and burn <S%H8313><s%> it with fire <S%H784><s%>: and I will make <S%H5414><s%> the cities <S%H5892><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> a desolation <S%H8077><s%> without an inhabitant <S%H3427><s%>.
